data.title: digital back for contax 645
data.meta_description: i would like information about digital back for contax 645. while i see many references to such, i can find very little information about the subject. anyone have sources i can check?
data.text:
i would like information about digital back for contax 645. while i see many references to such, i can find very little information about the subject. anyone have sources i can check? All the major digital back manufacturers make digital backs that will fit the Contax 645, and plan to continue to do so.

Try,
Phase One: www.phaseone.com
Leaf Systems (now part of Kodak), wit the Leaf Aptus being thier latest offering: http://graphics.kodak.com/global/product/digital_photography/default.htm
Sinar: http://www.sinar.ch/sinar/default.htm (find "Digital" under the "Products" heading on the menu), and
Imacon: http://www.imacon.dk/sw2264.asp (recently merged with Hassleblad so don't expect too much support for your superior Contax.)

These links should provide you with the detailed information you are looking for on the offerings from the main digital back manufacturers. Good luck. ((recently merged with Hassleblad so don't expect too much support for your superior Contax.)

Why would you think that?. Hasselblad is perfectly happy to sell you a $20,000 back for a Contax. Hasselblad is a business, not someone on the Jerry Springer Show, they are perfectly happy to sell you a product they make. Having shot pretty extensively with a Hasselblad H1 and a Contax 645 last year both with digital backs, I just didn'yt see any superiority: the contax was heavier, went through batteries dfaster and the autofocus of the Contax was much slower and no more accurate. The lenses for the Contax were quite nice but only marginally (if at all) better than the lenses for the H1. That didn't keep me from really liking using the Contax or thinking it was anything but a great camera -- but superior? Nope.

I used both cameras with digital backs. The best buy, if you can find one, will be a Kodak DCs Proback 645C -- it has limitations -- youn eed to work at ISO 100 to160 and forget about exposures longer than 2 seconds -- buit for landscape and portrait work the (discontinued ---just like the Contax 645 -- bit for different reasons) the Kodak 645 pro Backs are great. You should be able to find one for $5K or less. Kodak's processing software is also terrific -- really better than Capture One or Adobe Camera Raw
